intro: Paraboea sinensis var. glabrissima, commonly known as the silky paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
